summary: The Expediting Forest Restoration and Recovery Act of 2025 aims to amend the Healthy Forests Restoration Act of 2003. It directs the Secretary of Agriculture to expedite hazardous fuel and insect/disease risk reduction projects on National Forest System land, especially in designated insect and disease treatment areas. The bill outlines specific actions, including the application of categorical exclusions and environmental assessments, prioritizing risk reduction, and addressing fire regime groups. It also amends the Agricultural Act of 2014 regarding the treatment of revenue from timber sales under good neighbor agreements.
